Willman 1.label: Willman 1
Willman 1.description: Willman 1 is an ultra low-luminosity dwarf galaxy or a star cluster. Willman 1 was discovered in 2004. It is named after Beth Willman of Haverford College, the lead author of a study based on the Sloan Digital Sky Survey data. Wikipedia

MCG+04-35-017.label: MCG+04-35-017
MCG+04-35-017.description: MCG+04-35-017 is a galaxy in the constellation Boötes. It is part of a pair of galaxies, with MCG 4-35-16, as Arp 177. Wikipedia

UGC 8091.label: UGC 8091
UGC 8091.description: UGC 8091 is a gas-rich dwarf irregular galaxy. In 1995, Tolstoy et al. estimated its distance to be ~7.9 Million light-years from Earth. There is still open question regarding if it is a member of the Local Group. Wikipedia

Dwingeloo 2.label: Dwingeloo 2
Dwingeloo 2.description: Dwingeloo 2 is a small irregular galaxy discovered in 1996 and located about 10 million light-years away from the Earth. Its discovery was a result of Dwingeloo Obscured Galaxy Survey of the Zone of Avoidance. Wikipedia

Sextans A.label: Sextans A
Sextans A.description: Sextans A, is a tiny dwarf irregular galaxy. It spans about 5000 light-years across, and is located within the Local Group of galaxies, which includes our Milky Way galaxy. Wikipedia

Coma Berenices (dwarf galaxy).label: Coma Berenices
Coma Berenices (dwarf galaxy).description: Coma Berenices or Com is a dwarf spheroidal galaxy situated in the Coma Berenices constellation and discovered in 2006 in the data obtained by Sloan Digital Sky Survey. Wikipedia

Leo A.label: Leo A
Leo A.description: Leo A is an irregular galaxy that is part of the Local Group. It lies 2.25 million light-years from Earth. This galaxy was discovered by Fritz Zwicky in 1942. Wikipedia

Wolf-Lundmark-Melotte.label: Wolf–Lundmark–Melotte
Wolf-Lundmark-Melotte.description: The Wolf–Lundmark–Melotte is an irregular galaxy discovered in 1909 by Max Wolf, and is located on the outer edges of the Local Group. The discovery of the nature of the galaxy was accredited to Knut Lundmark and Philibert Jacques Melotte in 1926. Wikipedia

NGC 4656 and NGC 4657.label: NGC 4656 and NGC 4657
NGC 4656 and NGC 4657.description: NGC 4656/57 is a galaxy located in the constellation Canes Venatici and is sometimes informally called the Hockey Stick Galaxies or the Crowbar Galaxy. The galaxy is a member of the NGC 4631 Group. Wikipedia

Sextans B.label: Sextans B
Sextans B.description: Sextans B is an irregular galaxy that may be part of the Local Group, or lie just beyond it. Sextans B is 4.44 million light-years away from Earth and thus is one of most distant members of the Local Group, if it is indeed a member. Wikipedia

Mayall's Object.label: Mayall's Object
Mayall's Object.description: Mayall's Object is the result of two colliding galaxies located 500 million light years away within the constellation of Ursa Major. It was discovered by Nicholas U. Mayall of the Lick Observatory on 13 March 1940, using the Crossley reflector. Wikipedia

NGC 6027e.label: NGC 6027e
NGC 6027e.description: NGC 6027e is a tidal tail of NGC 6027 that is part of Seyfert's Sextet, a compact group of galaxies, which is located in the constellation Serpens. Wikipedia

Carina Dwarf.label: Carina Dwarf
Carina Dwarf.description: The Carina Dwarf Spheroidal is a dwarf galaxy in the Carina constellation. It was discovered in 1977 with the UK Schmidt Telescope by Cannon et al. Wikipedia

3C 390.3.label: 3C 390.3
3C 390.3.description: 3C 390.3 is a broad-line radio galaxy located in the constellation Draco. It is also a Seyfert 1 galaxy which is an X-ray source. Wikipedia

Fornax Dwarf.label: Fornax Dwarf
Fornax Dwarf.description: The Fornax Dwarf Spheroidal is an elliptical dwarf galaxy in the constellation Fornax that was discovered in 1938 by Harlow Shapley. Wikipedia

3C 236.label: 3C 236
3C 236.description: 3C 236 is a Fanaroff and Riley Class II radio galaxy. It is among the largest known radio galaxies, with the radio structure having a total linear size in excess of 4.5 Mpc; this makes it the second largest object known in the universe. Wikipedia

Canis Major Dwarf Galaxy.label: Canis Major Overdensity
Canis Major Dwarf Galaxy.description: The Canis Major Dwarf Galaxy or Canis Major Overdensity is a disputed dwarf irregular galaxy in the Local Group, located in the same part of the sky as the constellation Canis Major. Wikipedia

VIRGOHI21.label: VIRGOHI21
VIRGOHI21.description: VIRGOHI21 is an extended region of neutral hydrogen in the Virgo cluster discovered in 2005. Analysis of its internal motion indicates that it may contain a large amount of dark matter, as much as a small galaxy. Wikipedia

3C 83.1B.label: 3C 83.1B
3C 83.1B.description: 3C 83.1B is a Fanaroff and Riley class 1 radio galaxy located in the constellation Perseus. Its host is the elliptical galaxy NGC 1265, a member of the Perseus Cluster. Wikipedia

Circinus Galaxy.label: Circinus Galaxy
Circinus Galaxy.description: The Circinus Galaxy is a Seyfert galaxy in the Circinus constellation - and the closest to our Milky Way. It is only 4 degrees below the Galactic plane, and 13 million light-years away. Wikipedia

Holmberg IX.label: Holmberg IX
Holmberg IX.description: Holmberg IX is a dwarf irregular galaxy and a satellite galaxy of M81. The galaxy is named after Phillip Holmberg who first described it. Wikipedia

UGC 9561.label: UGC 9561
UGC 9561.description: UGC 9561 is a galaxy in the constellation Boötes. It is part of the Arp 173 pair of galaxies, with MCG+02-38-020. Wikipedia

UGC 11066.label: UGC 11066
UGC 11066.description: UGC 11066 is a galaxy in the Draco constellation. Wikipedia

ISOHDFS 27.label: ISOHDFS 27
ISOHDFS 27.description: ISOHDFS 27 is the most massive spiral galaxy known so far. It is approximately 6 billion light years from Earth. It has a mass of 1.04×10^12 solar masses, about four times as massive as the Milky Way. Wikipedia

Markarian 231.label: Markarian 231
Markarian 231.description: Markarian 231 is a Type-1 Seyfert galaxy that was discovered in 1969 as part of a search of galaxies with strong ultraviolet radiation. There are clear signs that a powerful active galactic nucleus is present in the center of the galaxy. Wikipedia

TN J0924-2201.label: TN J0924-2201
TN J0924-2201.description: TN J0924-2201 is the most distant radio galaxy known to date. It was discovered by Wil van Breugel in 1999. Wikipedia

NGC 7752 and NGC 7753.label: NGC 7752 and NGC 7753
NGC 7752 and NGC 7753.description:
NGC 7752 and NGC 7753 are a set of galaxies approximately 272 million light-years away in the constellation Pegasus.
NGC 7753 is the primary galaxy. It is a barred spiral galaxy with a small nucleus. NGC 7752 is the satellite galaxy of NGC 7753. Wikipedia

3C 305.label: 3C 305
3C 305.description: 3C 305 is a Seyfert 2 radio galaxy located in the constellation Draco. Wikipedia

Andromeda Galaxy.label: Andromeda Galaxy
Andromeda Galaxy.description: The Andromeda Galaxy is a spiral galaxy approximately 2.5 million light-years from Earth in the Andromeda constellation. Also known as Messier 31, M31, or NGC 224, it is often referred to as the Great Andromeda Nebula in older texts. Wikipedia

Arp 220.label: Arp 220
Arp 220.description: Arp 220 is the result of a collision between two galaxies which are now in the process of merging. Located 250 million light-years away in the constellation Serpens, it is the 220th object in Halton Arp's Atlas of Peculiar Galaxies. Wikipedia

Arp 271.label: Arp 271
Arp 271.description: Arp 271 is a pair of similarly sized interacting spiral galaxies, NGC 5426 and NGC 5427. It is not certain whether the galaxies are going to eventually collide or not. Wikipedia

Arp 276.label: Arp 276
Arp 276.description: Arp 276 is a pair of interacting galaxies NGC 935 and IC 1801 within the Aries constellation. NGC 935 is the northern member of the pair and IC 1801 is the southern. Wikipedia

Centaurus A.label: Centaurus A
Centaurus A.description: Centaurus A or NGC 5128 is a prominent galaxy in the constellation of Centaurus. It was discovered in 1826 by Scottish astronomer James Dunlop from his home in Parramatta, in New South Wales, Australia. Wikipedia

Eyes Galaxies.label: Eyes Galaxies
Eyes Galaxies.description: The Eyes Galaxies are a pair of galaxies about 52 million light-years away in the constellation Virgo. Wikipedia

IC 10.label: IC 10
IC 10.description: IC 10 is an irregular galaxy in the constellation Cassiopeia. It was discovered by Lewis Swift in 1887. Nicholas U. Mayall was the first to suggest that the object is extragalactic in 1935. Wikipedia

IC 1101.label: IC 1101
IC 1101.description: IC 1101 is a supergiant elliptical galaxy at the center of the Abell 2029 galaxy cluster. It is 1.07 billion light years away in the constellation of Virgo and is classified as a cD class of galaxy. Wikipedia

IC 1296.label: IC 1296
IC 1296.description: IC 1296 is a barred spiral galaxy in the constellation Lyra. It is a low surface brightness galaxy that lies in line of sight 4' to the northwest of the more famous planetary nebula M57 Ring Nebula. Wikipedia

IC 1613.label: IC 1613
IC 1613.description:
IC 1613 is an irregular dwarf galaxy in the constellation Cetus near the star 26 Ceti. It was discovered in 1906 by Max Wolf, and is approaching Earth at 234 km/s.
IC 1613 is a member of our Local Group. Wikipedia

IC 167.label: IC 167
IC 167.description: IC 167 is a barred spiral galaxy in the constellation of Aries. It was first reported by Bigourdan in 1891 and included in Dreyer's first Index Catalogue. Wikipedia

IC 195.label: IC 195
IC 195.description: IC 195 is a galaxy. It is part of the Arp 290 pair of galaxies, with IC 196 Wikipedia

IC 342.label: IC 342
IC 342.description: IC 342 is an intermediate spiral galaxy in the constellation Camelopardalis. The galaxy is near the galactic equator where dust obscuration makes it a difficult object for both amateur and professional ... Wikipedia

IC 4462.label: IC 4462
IC 4462.description: IC 4462 is a galaxy in the constellation Boötes. Wikipedia

IC 4526.label: IC 4526
IC 4526.description: IC 4526 is a galaxy in the constellation Boötes. Together with NGC 5829, it forms galaxy group Arp 42. Also, it is one of five members of galaxy group Hickson 73. Wikipedia

IC 982.label: IC 982
IC 982.description: IC 982 is a galaxy in the constellation Boötes. It is part of the Arp 117 pair of galaxies with IC 983. Wikipedia

IC 469.label: IC 469
IC 469.description: IC 469 is a spiral galaxy in the constellation of Cepheus. It is characterized by a compact nucleus, of oval shape, with perceptible side arms. Wikipedia

IC 983.label: IC 983
IC 983.description: IC 983 is a galaxy in the constellation Boötes. It is part of the Arp 117 pair of galaxies with IC 982. Wikipedia

Large Magellanic Cloud.label: Large Magellanic Cloud
Large Magellanic Cloud.description: The Large Magellanic Cloud is a nearby galaxy, and a satellite of the Milky Way. At a distance of slightly less than 50 kiloparsecs, the LMC is the third closest galaxy to the Milky Way, with the ... Wikipedia

Messier 100.label: Messier 100
Messier 100.description: Messier 100 is an example of a grand design spiral galaxy located within the southern part of constellation Coma Berenices. Wikipedia

Messier 105.label: Messier 105
Messier 105.description: Messier 105 is an elliptical galaxy in the constellation Leo. Wikipedia

Messier 108.label: Messier 108
Messier 108.description: Messier 108 is a barred spiral galaxy in the constellation Ursa Major. It was discovered by Pierre Méchain in 1781 or 1782. From the perspective of the Earth, this galaxy is seen almost edge-on. Wikipedia

Messier 32.label: Messier 32
Messier 32.description: Messier 32 is a dwarf elliptical galaxy about 2.65 million light-years away in the constellation Andromeda. M32 is a satellite galaxy of the famous Andromeda Galaxy and was discovered by Le Gentil in 1749. Wikipedia

Messier 106.label: Messier 106
Messier 106.description: Messier 106 is a spiral galaxy in the constellation Canes Venatici. It was discovered by Pierre Méchain in 1781. M106 is at a distance of about 22 to 25 million light-years away from Earth. Wikipedia

Messier 59.label: Messier 59
Messier 59.description: Messier 59 is an elliptical galaxy in the constellation Virgo. Wikipedia

Messier 60.label: Messier 60
Messier 60.description: Messier 60 is an elliptical galaxy approximately 55 million light-years away in the constellation Virgo. It is part of a pair of galaxies known as Arp 116 with NGC 4647. Wikipedia

Messier 58.label: Messier 58
Messier 58.description: Messier 58 is a barred spiral galaxy located within the constellation Virgo, approximately 68 million light-years away from Earth. Wikipedia

Messier 66.label: Messier 66
Messier 66.description: Messier 66 is an intermediate spiral galaxy about 36 million light-years away in the constellation Leo. It was discovered by Charles Messier in 1780. Wikipedia

Messier 74.label: Messier 74
Messier 74.description: Messier 74 is a face-on spiral galaxy in the constellation Pisces. It is at a distance of about 32 million light-years away from Earth. Wikipedia

Messier 77.label: Messier 77
Messier 77.description: Messier 77 is a barred spiral galaxy about 47 million light-years away in the constellation Cetus. Messier 77 is an active galaxy with an Active Galactic Nucleus, which is obscured from view by astronomical dust at visible wavelengths. Wikipedia

Messier 83.label: Messier 83
Messier 83.description: Messier 83 is a barred spiral galaxy approximately 15 million light-years away in the constellation Hydra. It is one of the closest and brightest barred spiral galaxies in the sky, making it visible with binoculars. Wikipedia

Messier 84.label: Messier 84
Messier 84.description: Messier 84 is an elliptical or lenticular galaxy in the constellation Virgo. M84 is situated in the heavily populated inner core of the Virgo Cluster of galaxies. Wikipedia

Messier 85.label: Messier 85
Messier 85.description:
Messier 85 is a lenticular galaxy, or elliptical galaxy for other authors, in the Coma Berenices constellation. It is 60 million light years away, and it is estimated to be 125,000 light years across.
It was discovered by Pierre Méchain in 1781. Wikipedia

Messier 82.label: Messier 82
Messier 82.description: Messier 82 is the prototype nearby starburst galaxy about 12 million light-years away in the constellation Ursa Major. Wikipedia

Messier 91.label: Messier 91
Messier 91.description: Messier 91 is a barred spiral galaxy located in the Coma Berenices constellation and is part of the Virgo Cluster of galaxies. M91 is about 63 million light-years away from the earth. Wikipedia

Messier 95.label: Messier 95
Messier 95.description: Messier 95 is a barred spiral galaxy about 38 million light-years away in the constellation Leo. It was discovered by Pierre Méchain in 1781, and catalogued by Charles Messier four days later. On 16 March 2012, a supernova was discovered in M95. Wikipedia

Messier 86.label: Messier 86
Messier 86.description: Messier 86 is an elliptical or lenticular galaxy in the constellation Virgo. It was discovered by Charles Messier in 1781. Wikipedia

Messier 96.label: Messier 96
Messier 96.description: Messier 96 is an intermediate spiral galaxy about 31 million light-years away in the constellation Leo. It was discovered by French astronomer Pierre Méchain on March 20, 1781. Wikipedia

Messier 98.label: Messier 98
Messier 98.description: Messier 98, also known as M98 or NGC 4192, is an intermediate spiral galaxy located about 44.4 million light-years away in the constellation Coma Berenices, about 6° to the east of the bright star Denebola. Wikipedia

NGC 1.label: NGC 1
NGC 1.description: NGC 1 is a spiral galaxy located 190 million light-years away in the constellation Pegasus. At about 90,000 light-years in diameter, it is just a little smaller than our galaxy, the Milky Way. Wikipedia

Messier 99.label: Messier 99
Messier 99.description: Messier 99 is an unbarred spiral galaxy approximately 50 million light-years away in the constellation Coma Berenices. Wikipedia

NGC 1023.label: NGC 1023
NGC 1023.description: NGC 1023 is a barred spiral galaxy and a member of the NGC 1023 group of galaxies in the Local Supercluster. Distance measurements vary from 9.3 to 19.7 million parsecs. Wikipedia

NGC 1032.label: NGC 1032
NGC 1032.description: NGC 1032 is a spiral galaxy that is about 117 million light-years away in the constellation Cetus. Wikipedia

NGC 10.label: NGC 10
NGC 10.description: NGC 10 is a spiral galaxy located in the Sculptor constellation. Wikipedia

NGC 1055.label: NGC 1055
NGC 1055.description: NGC 1055 is an edge-on spiral galaxy located in the constellation Cetus that has a prominent nuclear bulge crossed by a wide, knotty, dark lane of dust and gas. Wikipedia

NGC 1042.label: NGC 1042
NGC 1042.description: NGC 1042 is a spiral galaxy in the Constellation Cetus. Wikipedia

NGC 1090.label: NGC 1090
NGC 1090.description:
Galaxy NGC 1090 is a barred spiral galaxy with a pseudo inner ring. The disc has a very low surface brightness.
This galaxy has been the site of two known supernovae. Wikipedia

NGC 1087.label: NGC 1087
NGC 1087.description: NGC 1087 is an intermediate spiral galaxy in Cetus. The central bar/core is very small with many irregular features in the surrounding disk of material. With the many strange features of NGC 1087, its true nature is still uncertain. Wikipedia

NGC 1097.label: NGC 1097
NGC 1097.description:
NGC 1097 is a barred spiral galaxy about 45 million light-years away in the constellation Fornax. It was discovered by William Herschel on 9 October 1790. Three supernovae have been observed in NGC 1097.
NGC 1097 is also a Seyfert galaxy. Wikipedia

NGC 1073.label: NGC 1073
NGC 1073.description: NGC 1073 is a barred spiral galaxy in the constellation Cetus. It probably has a H II nucleus. Wikipedia

NGC 1156.label: NGC 1156
NGC 1156.description: NGC 1156 is a dwarf irregular galaxy in the Aries constellation of the type ibm. It is considered a Magellanic-type irregular. The galaxy has a larger than average core, and contains zones of contra-rotating gas. Wikipedia

NGC 11.label: NGC 11
NGC 11.description: NGC 11 is a spiral galaxy located in the Andromeda constellation. It is located at right ascension 00h 08m 42.5s; declination +37° 26′ 53″; under J2000.0 coordinates. Wikipedia

NGC 1128.label: NGC 1128
NGC 1128.description: NGC 1128 is a "dumbbell galaxy" in the Abell 400 galaxy cluster. It is the center of the 3C75 radio source and contains two orbiting supermassive black holes that may be merging. Wikipedia

NGC 1232.label: NGC 1232
NGC 1232.description:
NGC 1232 is an intermediate spiral galaxy about 60 million light-years away in the constellation Eridanus.
It is dominated by millions of bright stars and dark dust, in spiral arms rotating about the center. Wikipedia
